lead_paragraph: Louisiana officials say that the flooding has killed at least 13 and that about 30,000 people have been rescued. About 40,000 homes have been damaged.

byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson reported from Baton Rouge, and Alan Blinder from Atlanta.
byline.original: By CAMPBELL ROBERTSON and ALAN BLINDER

headline.print_headline: A Trip Through a Tragic Summer in Baton Rouge, Capped by Flooding
headline.main: Flooding Compounds Pain of Tragic Summer in Baton Rouge

snippet: Louisiana officials say that the flooding has killed at least 13 and that about 30,000 people have been rescued. About 40,000 homes have been damaged....
abstract: Federal Emergency Management Agency says around 7,000 people are now housed in 37 shelters across southern part of Louisiana, driven from their homes by floodwaters that have devastated Baton Rouge; flooding caps already difficult summer for city, which had previously weathered unrest, protests and violence due to police shooting of Alton Sterling and killing of three police officers.
